awd_titl_txt: Enhancement of Science/Mathematics Faculty Through Modeling: A Path Toward Critical Thinking
awd_abstract_narration: Enhancement of Science/Mathematics Faculty Through Modeling: A                  Path Toward Critical Thinking                                                   A coalition of six two-year and one four-year colleges in                       southeastern Kansas has designed an eighteen-month                              multidisciplinary project for faculty enhancement. In each of                   two summers there will be several week-long workshops designed                  to: (1) enhance content knowledge, (2) enhance critical                         thinking skills through the use of modeling, and (3) develop                    instructional strategies to promote effective teaching.                         Content areas include: modeling theory, molecular modeling,                     modeling in environmental science, recombinant DNA, revised                     college algebra, chromosome mapping, Maple V, chaos and fractal                 geometry, and classroom assessment.                                             Participants will develop and adopt curricular materials and                    assessment skills appropriate for their institutions. Academic                  year activities will provide continuity and participant                         support.***
